turns.speaker: JOE
turns.text: It's time to put this person where he belongs.

turns.speaker: PARRISH
turns.text: It's not necessary, Joe.  Drew's going to step aside --

turns.speaker: PARRISH
turns.text: I told you to shut up.

turns.speaker: JOE
turns.text: I'll take it from here --  I am --

turns.speaker: PARRISH
turns.text: The Treasury Department asked my cooperation in his undercover investigation of John Bontecou. They were convinced that Bontecou, on past deals, had structured his mergers and acquisitions in sus- picious and complicated ways so as to evade paying the taxes he is liable for.  The IRS wanted to go after him, and this deal offered them the opportunity.  I agreed to cooperate.

turns.speaker: PARRISH
turns.text: Moreover, Agent Joe Black here -- of course that's not his real name -- smelled out your involvement, Drew.  He developed evidence you were working both sides of the fence.  Unfortunately, that's known as a conflict of interest --

turns.speaker: PARRISH
turns.text: I guess you have your reasons.

turns.speaker: PARRISH
turns.text: That's life.  What can I tell you?

turns.speaker: PARRISH
turns.text: Am I dreaming this?  Are you a dream?

turns.speaker: PARRISH
turns.text: You're coming to 'take me'.  What is that?  Who the hell are you?

turns.speaker: PARRISH
turns.text: You're not Death.  You're just a kid in a jacket and a pair of pants.

turns.speaker: YOUNG MAN
turns.text: The jacket and the pair of pants came with the body I took.  Let me ask your opinion.  Do I blend in?

turns.speaker: PARRISH
turns.text: You want me to be your guide --?

turns.speaker: PARRISH
turns.text: I do?  How long will you be staying?

turns.speaker: YOUNG MAN
turns.text: You should hope quite a while.

turns.speaker: PARRISH
turns.text: This is crazy -- you're not going to eat dinner with us.

turns.speaker: YOUNG MAN
turns.text: Bill, I am eating dinner with you. And your family.  And that's what we're doing.  It's not open for discussion.  Nothing is.  Don't you understand?

turns.speaker: PARRISH
turns.text: Excuse me?  Could I say something?

turns.speaker: PARRISH
turns.text: When I introduce you, if I say who you are, I don't think anyone will stay for dinner.

turns.speaker: VOICE
turns.text: '...I know, it's none of my business.'

turns.speaker: VOICE
turns.text: 'Yes' is the answer to your question.

turns.speaker: VOICE
turns.text: Try.  Because 'if you haven't tried, you haven't lived'.

turns.speaker: VOICE
turns.text: No, you're not.  You're trying to 'handle' the situation but this is the one situation you knew you never could handle.

turns.speaker: PARRISH
turns.text: Where are you?  Are you there?

turns.speaker: VOICE
turns.text: There's going to be plenty of time for that.

turns.speaker: PARRISH
turns.text: What is this, a joke, right?  Some kind of elaborate practical joke? At my 40th reunion, we delivered a casket to the Class president's hotel room and --

turns.speaker: VOICE
turns.text: The great Bill Parrish at a loss for words?  The man from whose lips fall 'rapture' and 'passion' and 'obses- sion'...all those admonitions about being 'deliberately happy', what there is no sense 'living your life without...', all the sparks and energy you give off, the rosy advice you dispense in round, pear-shaped tones --

turns.speaker: PARRISH
turns.text: What the hell is this?  Who are you?

turns.speaker: VOICE
turns.text: Just think of millenniums multiplied by aeons compounded by infinity, I've been around that long, but it's only recently that your affairs here have piqued my interest.  Call it boredom, the natural curiosity of me, the most lasting and significant element in existence has come to see you.

turns.speaker: VOICE
turns.text: I want to have a look around before I take you.

turns.speaker: VOICE
turns.text: It requires competence, wisdom, experience -- all those things they say about you in testimonials -- and you're the one.

turns.speaker: VOICE
turns.text: Show me around.  Be my guide.  And in return, you get...

turns.speaker: PARRISH
turns.text: What the hell are you talking about?

turns.speaker: VOICE
turns.text: In return you'll receive minuets, days, weeks, I'm not going to go into details ... what matters is that I stay interested.

turns.speaker: VOICE
turns.text: 'Yes' is the answer to your ques- tion.

turns.speaker: VOICE
turns.text: Bill.  Come on.  The question.  The question you've been asking yourself with increased regularity, at odd moments, panting through the extra game of handball, when you ran for the plane in Delhi, when you sat up in bed last night and hit the floor in the office this morning.  The question that is in the back of your throat, choking the blood to your brain, ringing in the ears over and over as you put it to yourself --

turns.speaker: QUINCE
turns.text: I am, this is it.  B Day.

turns.speaker: QUINCE
turns.text: Bontecou Day.  Going to close with Big John -- Look at you, Bill, all cool as a cat and over at Bontecou's, I'll bet he's shitting in his pants.

turns.speaker: QUINCE
turns.text: ...I read you all the way on the Bontecou thing, and I know where you're coming from.  And I'm with you a hundred and one percent.

turns.speaker: QUINCE
turns.text: But I've got to tell you, if mergers are in the wild, I've got some great prospects I've developed.  I want to talk to you about them next week.

turns.speaker: PARRISH
turns.text: No, anything is possible.  It's up to Joe.

turns.speaker: QUINCE
turns.text: Joe, you don't know how glad I am you're aboard.  Anybody who can take some of the weight off the old man, I'm in his corner.

turns.speaker: QUINCE
turns.text: This is great, honey.  The orange. Has it got a little vodka in it? Like that Finnish stuff, orange vodka --  Put your lips around this one, Bill. It's out of this world.

turns.speaker: PARRISH
turns.text: No thank you, Quince.  I'm sorry, honey.  I'm no good at this.  Why don't you choose whatever cake you like?

turns.speaker: QUINCE
turns.text: But he does give a shit.  Don't you, Bill?

turns.speaker: QUINCE
turns.text: See.  There.  What'd I tell you?

turns.speaker: QUINCE
turns.text: The vodka.  What'd I tell you?

turns.speaker: QUINCE
turns.text: ...what can I say after I say that I'm sorry?  I zipped when I should've zagged, I opened my big mouth one too many times, everything got all twisted --

turns.speaker: PARRISH
turns.text: It's okay, Quince.  I understand. You've always meant well and I appreciate that.  Sometimes things just turn out -- wrong.

turns.speaker: QUINCE
turns.text: Come in, Joe -- I want to thank you -- okay, Bill?

turns.speaker: QUINCE
turns.text: Joe knew the whole story.  I told him.  It was his idea that I come clean.  I mean I wanted to come clean but he gave me a pair of balls, you know what I mean?

turns.speaker: PARRISH
turns.text: All in all, what Bill wants to do is build the golden bridge to Drew with no hard feelings.

turns.speaker: QUINCE
turns.text: You think Drew will go for it?

turns.speaker: PARRISH
turns.text: Quince, I've got confidence in you.

turns.speaker: SLOANE
turns.text: Why don't we let it rest for the moment?  Give it some air?

turns.speaker: PARRISH
turns.text: Well said, Eddie.  Mr. Black, shall we?

turns.speaker: PARRISH
turns.text: Please, Eddie, no 'Fat Lady Sings" shit.

turns.speaker: SLOANE
turns.text: I still sense some doubt in this group, we could turn it around. You'll be up in the country?

turns.speaker: PARRISH
turns.text: Yes, the big 'celebration' of my mandatory retirement birthday. You're an honored guest, Eddie.

turns.speaker: SLOANE
turns.text: I'm going to stick it out here.  We still have a shot.

turns.speaker: SLOANE
turns.text: Yeah - Bill - How are you?  You okay?

turns.speaker: PARRISH
turns.text: Fine, fine.  Big doing up here.  Why are you still down here?

turns.speaker: SLOANE
turns.text: The Board's working through the weekend, tying up the loose ends on this damn thing.  But I want to give it one more try, I'm still holding out some hope.

turns.speaker: PARRISH
turns.text: Eddie, hold out all the hope you want but, I promise you, it's hope- less, it's over.  Come on up, let's get drunk, if I had your shoulder to lean on I might actually enjoy this --

turns.speaker: SLOANE
turns.text: No, I'm going to stay down here, keep my finger in the dike and maybe by Monday, the waters could recede.

turns.speaker: PARRISH
turns.text: If you're trying to show me lay- down-in-front-of-the-bus loyalty, forget it.

turns.speaker: SLOANE
turns.text: Sorry, Bill, have a drink, eat your cake, blow out the candles and make a wish.  Talk to you Monday.  Okay?

turns.speaker: PARRISH
turns.text: Okay, Eddie -- anyway, thanks for the memory.

turns.speaker: PARRISH
turns.text: I appreciate this, Eddie, members of the Board, this will just take a minute of your time.  As the custo- dians of the company, you may re- ceive information from what follows that is valuable to you --  -- or not.  Either way, thanks.

turns.speaker: PARRISH
turns.text: Well, thank you, that's great, but it's more than I bargained for.  I just wanted to set the record straight.

turns.speaker: SLOANE
turns.text: But we want you back, Bill.  Mean- while, enjoy your party, celebrate, we'll attend to the nasty details. And Mr. Black, may we say thank you.

turns.speaker: SUSAN
turns.text: He wanted to ride back down with you. Now sit and relax, get some- thing in that flat tummy of yours --

turns.speaker: SUSAN
turns.text: Will you relax?  I know it is a big deal day --

turns.speaker: PARRISH
turns.text: Thank God.  Now could we go?  Let's get this day started.

turns.speaker: SUSAN
turns.text: I thought you were in a meeting--?

turns.speaker: PARRISH
turns.text: I know it's none of my business --

turns.speaker: SUSAN
turns.text: You mean like you loved Mom?

turns.speaker: PARRISH
turns.text: Forget about me and Mom -- are you going to marry him?

turns.speaker: PARRISH
turns.text: Susan, you're a hell of a woman. You've got a great career, you're beautiful --

turns.speaker: SUSAN
turns.text: And I'm your daughter and no man will ever be good enough for me.

turns.speaker: PARRISH
turns.text: Well, I wasn't going to say that --

turns.speaker: SUSAN
turns.text: What were you going to say?

turns.speaker: PARRISH
turns.text: Listen, I'm crazy about the guy -- He's smart, he's aggressive, he could carry Parrish Communications into the 21st century and me along with it.

turns.speaker: PARRISH
turns.text: That's for me.  I'm talking about you.  It's not so much what you say about Drew, it's what you don't say.

turns.speaker: PARRISH
turns.text: Oh yes, I am.  Not an ounce of excitement, not a whisper of a thrill, this relationship has all the passion of a pair of titmice.

turns.speaker: PARRISH
turns.text: Well, it worries me.  I want you to get swept away.  I want you to levitate.  I want you to sing with rapture and dance like a dervish.

turns.speaker: PARRISH
turns.text: Be deliriously happy.  Or at least leave yourself open to be.

turns.speaker: SUSAN
turns.text: 'Be deliriously happy'.  I'm going to do my upmost --

turns.speaker: PARRISH
turns.text: I know it's a cornball thing but love is passion, obsession, someone you can't live without.  If you don't start with that, what are you going to end up with?  I say fall head over heels.  Find someone you can love like crazy and who'll love you the same way back.  And how do you find him?  Forget your head and listen to your heart.  I'm not hearing any heart.  Run the risk, if you get hurt, you'll come back.  Because, the truth is there is no sense living your life without this.  To make the journey and not fall deeply in love -- well, you haven't lived a life at all. You have to try.  Because if you haven't tried, you haven't lived.

turns.speaker: SUSAN
turns.text: I'm sorry.  But give it to me again. The short version.

turns.speaker: PARRISH
turns.text: Stay open.  Who knows?  Lightning could strike.

turns.speaker: SUSAN
turns.text: I won't.  And when I tell Drew about it, he won't either.

turns.speaker: PARRISH
turns.text: You won't tell him, and even if you did, he'd clock it and punch it into his laptop in order to pull out some key phrases when he gives the Commencement Speech at Wharton.

turns.speaker: PARRISH
turns.text: I know.  But I'm the only father you've got.

turns.speaker: PARRISH
turns.text: He doesn't care.  But thanks anyway.

turns.speaker: PARRISH
turns.text: A-Okay.  Got my gloves on, my ears pricked.  I'm ready for action.

turns.speaker: SUSAN
turns.text: -- This morning.  The Corinth Coffee Shop.  He was looking for a doctor.

turns.speaker: PARRISH
turns.text: Uh - will that hold you, Joe?

turns.speaker: SUSAN
turns.text: Funny, I don't get that feeling. Maybe it's because you found out I'm Bill Parrish's daughter.

turns.speaker: PARRISH
turns.text: Cut it out, Susan.  You and I've got to talk.  Big day tomorrow, everybody.  Joe, let's go.

turns.speaker: SUSAN
turns.text: Yeah, it's good to get together.

turns.speaker: PARRISH
turns.text: Do you mind if I raise a little caution flag?

turns.speaker: PARRISH
turns.text: What is the nature of your interest in Joe?

turns.speaker: SUSAN
turns.text: Well, remember how you told me about "lightning striking"?  The nature of it's in there somewhere.

turns.speaker: PARRISH
turns.text: I won't say you may be getting onto shaken ground --

turns.speaker: PARRISH
turns.text: I don't think this is the lightning you are looking for.  Drew's a good man.  I know I didn't seem to be completely in his corner before, but I've come to appreciate --

turns.speaker: SUSAN
turns.text: Now we love Drew and Joe in verbo- ten?  What's going on?

turns.speaker: SUSAN
turns.text: When you say 'nothing' that way, it's not nothing.

turns.speaker: SUSAN
turns.text: Because I was sitting in a staff meeting, incredibly bored, my mind kept wandering and the only place it landed was -- Joe.

turns.speaker: SUSAN
turns.text: Love.  Passion.  Obsession, all those things you told me to wait for.  Well, they've arrived.

turns.speaker: SUSAN
turns.text: Why?  A man appears at your side, almost never leaves it, you clearly trust him, depend on him, I sense you value him deeply, why aren't those things good enough for me?

turns.speaker: PARRISH
turns.text: You don't know anything about Joe --

turns.speaker: SUSAN
turns.text: What are you afraid of, Dad?  That I'll fall head over heels for Joe -- well, I have -- as you did with Mom.  That's always been standard, whether you like or not.

turns.speaker: PARRISH
turns.text: Susan, I don't think Joe is going to be with us long.

turns.speaker: PARRISH
turns.text: I don't know, I can't say --

turns.speaker: SUSAN
turns.text: C'mon!  The guy's working with you. You always know chapter and verse about everyone who works --

turns.speaker: PARRISH
turns.text: In this case, I can't.  I - uh -- I just can't help you.  I only would tell you -- that with Joe, you are on very, very dangerous ground.

turns.speaker: PARRISH
turns.text: I don't care if you love him!  I'm telling you he's no good for you!

turns.speaker: SUSAN
turns.text: You were right about Joe, he is going somewhere --

turns.speaker: PARRISH
turns.text: I want you to know how much I love you.  That you've given a meaning to my life that I had no right to expect, and that no one can ever take from me.

turns.speaker: PARRISH
turns.text: No -- I love you so much and I want you to promise me something.  I don't want you to ever worry about me.  If anything should happen, I'm going to be fine and everything's going to be all right.  -- And I have no regrets.

turns.speaker: PARRISH
turns.text: I'm still here.  Would you like to dance with me, Susan?

turns.speaker: PARRISH
turns.text: If you don't mind dancing with an old fogey like me.

turns.speaker: SUSAN
turns.text: Oh, Dad, you're not old.  You'll never be old.

turns.speaker: SUSAN
turns.text: The fireworks are about to start.

turns.speaker: YOUNG MAN
turns.text: Good morning, I was talking kind of loud there, sorry.

turns.speaker: SUSAN
turns.text: Not at all.  It was fascinating.

turns.speaker: YOUNG MAN
turns.text: Oh yeah?  What was 'fascinating' about it?

turns.speaker: YOUNG MAN
turns.text: My kid sister.  She just broke up with her boyfriend and she's thinking about dropping out of law school.

turns.speaker: YOUNG MAN
turns.text: Nothing to be sorry about.  That's the way with men and women, isn't it?

turns.speaker: SUSAN
turns.text: I was just being agreeable, now I've got to explain why?

turns.speaker: YOUNG MAN
turns.text: I'm not trying to sharpshoot you, but that 'nothing lasts' stuff, that's what was the trouble with Honey's guy.  He was fooling around and Honey caught him at it.  One girlfriend wasn't enough for him.

turns.speaker: YOUNG MAN
turns.text: Damn right.  Looking for her right now.  Who knows?  You might be her.

turns.speaker: YOUNG MAN
turns.text: Everybody's a doctor around here. This apartment house is all green pajamas and slippers.  The guy I'm waiting for to vacate is a doctor. What kind of doctor?

turns.speaker: YOUNG MAN
turns.text: So if I needed a doctor, you could be it?

turns.speaker: SUSAN
turns.text: Yes, I could.  I have an office in the hospital.

turns.speaker: YOUNG MAN
turns.text: -- This is my lucky day.  I arrive in this big bad city and I not only find a doctor, a beautiful woman as well.

turns.speaker: YOUNG MAN
turns.text: And I want to get into my apartment and go to work.  Please, what do you say, another cup of coffee?

turns.speaker: YOUNG MAN
turns.text: ...It's kind of a pro bono job.

turns.speaker: SUSAN
turns.text: 'Pro bono'.  That means doing good -- Going to be doing good all your life?

turns.speaker: YOUNG MAN
turns.text: I know what you're saying.  Doesn't pay very well.  Depends on the woman I marry.  Maybe she'd like a bigger house, a better car, lotsa kids, college doesn't come cheap --

turns.speaker: SUSAN
turns.text: You'd give up what you want for the woman you marry?

turns.speaker: SUSAN
turns.text: You'll have a hard time finding a woman like that these days --

turns.speaker: YOUNG MAN
turns.text: You never know.  Lightning could strike.

turns.speaker: SUSAN
turns.text: No, it was so right it scares me.

turns.speaker: YOUNG MAN
turns.text: I've been thinking... I don't want you to be my doctor.  Because I don't want you to examine me.

turns.speaker: YOUNG MAN
turns.text: Because I like you so much.  You have coffee here every morning, don't you?  If I came by, could you give me the name of a doctor?

turns.speaker: SUSAN
turns.text: Sure, I'll give you the name of a doctor.  ...And I don't want to examine you.

turns.speaker: SUSAN
turns.text: Because I like you so much.  Now I've got to go.

turns.speaker: SUSAN
turns.text: ...We know so little about each other.

turns.speaker: NATALIE
turns.text: It's not your fault. See, you have this condition...

turns.speaker: NATALIE
turns.text: This has nothing to do with you. You helped me out, and I'm grateful.

turns.speaker: NATALIE
turns.text: Relax a little, okay? Take off your jacket.

turns.speaker: NATALIE
turns.text: I know about your fucking condition, Leonard! I probably know more about it than you do! You don't have a fucking clue about anything else!

turns.speaker: NATALIE
turns.text: Not to me! I wasn't fucking married to her!

turns.speaker: NATALIE
turns.text: I've got to get back for the evening shift, so make yourself at home, watch T.V., whatever. Just grab a blanket and pillow off the bed. I never need them all anyway.

turns.speaker: TEDDY
turns.text: You read it off your fucking photo. You don't know me, you don't even know who you are.

turns.speaker: TEDDY
turns.text: Because you're relying on them alone. You Don't remember what you've discovered or how. Your notes might be unreliable.

turns.speaker: TEDDY
turns.text: Sense of humour went with the memory, huh? You know why you're still here, don't you?

turns.speaker: LEONARD
turns.text: It's simple, you just go to the bathroom.

turns.speaker: LEONARD
turns.text: Just loud enough to wake me up.

turns.speaker: LEONARD
turns.text: No. Just leave the stuff lying around as if it were yours. Like you just took it off or something.

turns.speaker: BURT
turns.text: What can I do for you, Leonard?

turns.speaker: LEONARD
turns.text: Burt, I'm not sure, but I may have asked you to hold my calls -  MEMENTO Blue Revisions - 8/27/99

turns.speaker: LEONARD
turns.text: I think I may have. I'm not good on the phone.

turns.speaker: BURT
turns.text: You said you like to look people in the eye when you talk to them. Don't you remember?

turns.speaker: LEONARD
turns.text: That's the thing. I have this condition.

turns.speaker: LEONARD
turns.text: No. It's different. I have no short-term memory. I know who I am and all about myself, but since my injury I can't make any new memories. Everything fades. If we talk for too long, I'll forget how we started. I don't know if we've ever met before, and the next time I see you I won't remember this conversation. So if I seem strange or rude, that's probably...
